programme.title: Rosewood
programme.desc: Spurred by a white woman's lie, vigilantes destroy a black Florida town and slay inhabitants in 1923.

programme.title: Ghosts of Mississippi
programme.desc: A Mississippi prosecutor (Alec Baldwin) and the widow (Whoopi Goldberg) of Medgar Evers crusade to retry a white racist (James Woods) for the 1963 murder of the NAACP leader.

programme.title: Jazz Session at the Blue Note With Chaka Khan
programme.sub-title: Jazz Session at the Blue Note With Chaka Khan
programme.desc: Recorded in 1993 at the Blue Note Jazz Club in New York City, this performance by Chaka Khan features a number of songs closely associated with jazz.

programme.title: The Harder They Come
programme.desc: An ambitious young Jamaican is forced into a life of crime after arriving in Kingston to launch a music career.

programme.title: The Final Comedown
programme.desc: Out of racism rises a young militant leader (Billy Dee Williams) who thinks the only answer is armed revolution.

programme.title: It's Showtime at the Apollo
programme.desc: Guests are C+C Music Factory (featuring Freedom Williams), Lisette Melendez, and Ralph Harris.

programme.title: It's Showtime at the Apollo
programme.desc: Rising comics and singers are showcased.

programme.title: It's Showtime at the Apollo
programme.desc: Rising comics and singers are showcased.

programme.title: It's Showtime at the Apollo
programme.desc: Rising comics and singers are showcased.

programme.title: That's the Way of the World
programme.desc: Record-industry mobsters make an executive (Harvey Keitel) push a boring family trio instead of Earth, Wind & Fire.

programme.title: A Chance in the World
programme.desc: A wounded and broken boy becomes a man of resilience and vision.

programme.title: When it Comes Around
programme.desc: A young, successful sports executive falls in love with a new agent at his office. The beautiful woman manipulates him and uses him as a pawn for her advancement.

programme.title: Betty: They Say I'm Different
programme.desc: Betty Davis arrives on the '70s scene to break boundaries for women with her daring personality and outrageous funk music. She then, despite being banned and boycotted, goes on to become the first black woman to perform, write and manage herself.

programme.title: Judge Dad
programme.desc: During a cruise Brett says Jenna left with another guy. He wants her to pay her half since she got a new man.

programme.title: Judge Dad
programme.desc: Matthew claims Jenny made false accusations about him stealing from the company because he didn't respond to her romantic advances; she feels if he has a problem with being fired, he should take it up with their boss.

programme.title: Judge Mom
programme.desc: Julie wants her husband, Chris, to save for their child's schooling, rather than blowing every extra cent he gets on expensive shoes and other bling.

programme.title: Crime Stoppers: Case Files
programme.desc: Moussa Salti was killed by thieves in his store; Lamar Lewis was killed by a rider in the same car.

programme.title: Crime Stoppers: Case Files
programme.desc: The unsolved murders of Juan Allayo and Dean Young.

programme.title: Swordfish
programme.desc: A spy (John Travolta) working for the CIA forces a computer hacker (Hugh Jackman), who was recently released from prison, to help steal unused government funds.

programme.title: Romeo Must Die
programme.desc: While seeking vengeance for his brother's murder, a former Hong Kong policeman (Jet Li) falls for his foe's daughter (Aaliyah).
